message.content:
cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.DB, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of representative subset selection, which is a fundamental problem in data science and machine learning. The paper proposes a framework for solving this problem over sliding windows, which is a common scenario in data stream processing. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) category, which deals with the design and analysis of efficient algorithms and data structures for solving computational problems. 

The paper also proposes a submodular maximization problem to capture the "diminishing returns" property of the representativeness of selected subsets, which is a common approach in machine learning and optimization. This suggests that the paper is also likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) category, which deals with the design and analysis of algorithms that can learn from and make predictions on data. 

The paper also mentions the data recency issue and the need to support different types of constraints, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) category, which deals with the design and analysis of algorithms for searching and retrieving information from large collections of data. 

The paper also mentions the use of an index to manage the checkpoints and improve efficiency, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.DB (Databases) category, which deals with the design and analysis of database systems and related technologies.
